name: symgbasf
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c2), wf1o(c0, c2, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf1o(c0, c2, c2))
-| wi(wf1o(c0, c2, c2), wf(c0, c2, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf1o(c0, c2, c2))
-| wi(wf1o(c0, c2, c2), wf(c0, c2, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf1o(c0, c2, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csymg, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 : c2 ↔ c2))
⊣ c3 =(SymGrp ` c2)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c2))
-| wi(wf1o(c0, c2, c2), wf(c0, c2, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csymg, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c0, c2, c2))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(csymg, c2))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 : c2 → c2))
⊣ c3 =(SymGrp ` c2)
⊣ c1 =(Base ` c3)

comment: A permutation (element of the symmetric group) is a function from a set into itself. (Contributed by AV, 1-Jan-2019.)
